author: {'steamid': '76561198866942343', 'num_games_owned': 317, 'num_reviews': 473, 'playtime_forever': 227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1668984391}
review:
The concept is solid. The graphics and sound effects aren't high resolution or detailed, but are detailed enough for a low budget title. If this title had tight, reliable controls and a reasonable camera, it would be on the recommended side of average. Unfortunately, the controls are extremely loose, there's no gamepad support, and the camera rotates in such a way as to create confusion regarding directional movement. Admittedly, there's a top down view you can opt to choose as well.

It's also a $14.99 title. This is definitely far from a $15 title.

Fix the controls, add gamepad support, fix the camera, and either add upgrades, other management mechanics, and/or other content OR lower the price to $4.99 or less, and it would be a recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561199221334170', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1637159754}

review:
It's soccer with robots. Kind of like a top down Rocket League. Control your robot and try to kick some goals. But you don't have feet. Doesn't matter. Use your robot skills to score.
https://youtu.be/VyfNxPwfBsU

author: {'steamid': '76561198198213922', 'num_games_owned': 252, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 3852, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1371, 'last_played': 1643231888}
review:
JUST TO LET YOU KNOW: I'm above standard playtime on this game and I'm currently #1 in the leaderboards! So mine and others players experience isn't the same (avarge have about 0.1-6h playtime I got more)

When you start the game you need to do a tutorial to learn to control the robot, and just learn the basics (really quick)
It exist some gamemodes:
Friendly Match: Chose map, How long the match would be, Chose players then the difficulty
Championship: Chose your country and repeat from above^
Local Multiplayer: Can't give my opinion just test it with my self it's probably fun but I can't give my opinion on this!
Maps: Pitch with obstracles in it and classic football pitch!
Options: You have potato or monster pc? Dosen't matter it's not high quality settings
The soundtrack is kinda bad so use your spotify or something if it annoy you!
The bots are really easy to play against, the championship is still fun!
If you play alot you gonna think it's easier more you play!
Are you looking for online game? This game have official steam leaderboards but you can't start a game with your friends (if you not play local) So if you looking for online game, this is not for you!
If you don't have friends like me, this is perfect to play :D
Do I recomend it? Ofcourse I do, you gonna enjoy it alot :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198063990714', 'num_games_owned': 457, 'num_reviews': 164, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1519522435}
review:
played this and quite enjoyed it  but it still feels  clunky even when using a controller I tried the 8BIT DO AND XBOX ONE controller they worked ok to be honest
so I left it for a while....after several updates the game is a little better but sucks as the Ai is no fun at al
they dont pass  or take that many ranodm crazy shots at goal so you can ge a cool rebound
if your lucky the ball sticks to you but more or less rebounds of your mech
the mechs are all kinda the same no make a bot no creat a track 
in fact its only worth it when playing against another human
its no rocket league but then this game is a fiver 
game needs map editor more field to play on and modes and a mech/robot creation type mechanic
power up would be cool
how about big ball bigger goalposts (they are too small IMO) SMALL MECH LARGE MEC
ideas abound .. I have to say it still needs work  it has potential id buy it for multiplayer  as AI is useless at times But not totaly useless the challenge is there they are quick to react and
score better goals.... i recommend playing with a friend  so  I can recommend it only for that

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3JSkaYhZjLI&t=3s

author: {'steamid': '76561197987748019', 'num_games_owned': 648, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 191, 'last_played': 1565031992}
review:
I enjoy this game very much. Nicely and varied designed arenas, Controls may be a bit stiff, but i can overlook it since it's a solid overall experience for me. ;-)

I would like to see the possibility to make custom maps in the future and a goal replay, but nothing u (the developers) have to rush. :)

Sometimes the ball glitches through the boundaries of the pitch/arena. But not very often,

Keep it up, boys!

author: {'steamid': '76561198060364008', 'num_games_owned': 406, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1493391439}
review: I bought and run it. And then my keyboard went dead. Not a single key had any effect on the game. I couldn't even left the game or press CTR+ALT-DELETE to kill it. No matter what I tried to do nothing happened, completely dead keyboard. I had to hard reset the comp, and tried again, but as soon I went into this game the same repeats. I asked Steam for refund.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110614150', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1590227352}
review:
Ein kleines nettes Spiel mit viel Potential.

Ich f√§nde es toll, wenn es verschiedene Roboter 
mit verschiedenen F√§higkeiten geben w√ºrde.
Geschwindigkeitsboost, Waffen, "Bananensch√ºsse"
Da g√§be es sicher viele M√∂glichkeiten.

Was mir beim Spielen auffiel ist, das der Ballf√ºhrende 
Roboter meist schwierig von selbigem zu trennen war.
Beim "Dribbeln" gibt es keine zeitliche Begrenzung, dass kann
zu ewigem Kreisfahren f√ºhren. F√ºr die Verfolger w√§re das ziemlich
frustrierend. Ein Paar Raketen auf solche Leute abfeuern w√ºrde 
sicher Spa√ü machen. Oder typische Robotorkampfwaffen wie
S√§ge, Walzen, etc...
Zumindest sollte die Geschwindigkeit beim Ballf√ºhren gedrosselt werden.
Das es mehr Sinn macht zu schie√üen.

Auch interaktivere Arenen w√§ren klasse. Die Idee mit den Autoreifen 
(die man auch auf die Gegner schie√üen kann) ist klasse.
Cool w√§re, wenn ein Treffer zum Ballverlust f√ºhren w√ºrde.
Nur bitte haltet sie von den Toren fern. Das gibt Spielern die M√∂glichkeit 
das Tor mit Reifen zu verstopfen!!

Fazit:
Das Spiel macht jetzt schon Spa√ü!
Vorallem weckt es viele Hoffnungen auf neue Features!
Wenn die Entwicklung gut verl√§uft w√ºrde ich auf jeden
Fall sagen, dass in der Bibliothek etwas fehlt, wenn
Robot Soccer Challenge nicht enthalten ist!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198142974562', 'num_games_owned': 3754, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1574953344}
review:
As it is it becomes quite repetive and boring. The game seriously need something to spice it up a bit. I would sugest a bigger field, more robots and teaching AI to recieve a pass as a starting point...

I'll try it again in some time to see if something has been done to make it more interesting. But till then its a no from me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034977092', 'num_games_owned': 1686, 'num_reviews': 375, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1512329099}
review:
Mi dispiace sempre dare voti negativi a giochi ancora in accesso anticipato, ma allo stato attuale delle cose non posso davvero consigliare questo titolo. Tra gli aspetti pi√π negativi abbiamo l'IA davvero pessima e l'assenza di multiplayer online, ma purtroppo la lista delle cose negative √® davvero lunga.

Per chi volesse approfondire un pelo la situazione, ho realizzato un video che vi schiarir√† le idee in meno di 5 minuti:

author: {'steamid': '76561198026373095', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1511576734}
review:
I bought this game from the Black Friday Sales and played an hour and a half. I played online and with bots, so hre we go:

Pros:
- Multiplayer is all laughs, seriously. I played with a friend and is all laughs.
- Normal and "rubbish" changeable fields. I enjoyed more the latter, but I find interesting to have both (since I've seen that before didn't exist the normal one).
- Goal posts are so tiny. When playing online is no use than to push, but in bots yo have to distract them to leave the goal empty. Maybe a larger goal would be interesting, but for now I feel it's fine.
- Thank god you can change timing and number of players when playing the championship.


Cons:
- Bots are easy, even the hard/fast ones. Even without knowing how to play properly. I would like an even faster game.
- It feels a bit simple and stuck when playing and going for the ball. Should they add some things like weapons? Or maybe some field powers?
- Championship is also simple, but that's the usual in these games. I consider it "con" (but constructive) because maybe could have a FIFA-like system with better/worse players and keep changing them, like a career progress. I only say this because the game is still in development, so there could be time for this.

For what it offers, right now is a little bit expensive, but we all hope it will get better and it will pay :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198073395575', 'num_games_owned': 281, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1515941084}
review:
First things first, this isn't anything like Rocket League, aside from the concept of "vehicles knock balls into goals". It's a lot more like Robot Wars: Extreme Destruction's Football mode, but with actual ball control and shooting instead of aimlessly knocking a ball about (although a mode without the shooting mechanic could be great).
I thought the AI would be very simple in this early access stage, and while they were always chasing the ball rather than one chase a ball, the other wait for a pass (which, to be fair, is fairly advanced AI), they did understand defending the net when you have the ball, as well as even chipping it over you if you're charging towards them.
The only real problem I had was that sometimes the ball would clip out of the arena if I shot too hard, and it wouldn't come back, so I just had to wait for the match to finish. 

All in all, it has potential to be a solid robot soccer game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198168921104', 'num_games_owned': 469, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1537353117}
review:
Robot Soccer, a merge between the Football Minigame in Robot Wars: Extreme Destruction and Rocket League.

Robot Soccer is of a simplistic design, accompanied with simplistic controls. You control a robot with pincers which allow you to catch the ball. You manouver your robot with the WASD keys and can either Chip the ball, causing a higher ball with less power (Right click on mouse.) or do a power shot, causing the ball to go fast and straight (Left click on mouse.)

So far, whilst being new to the game a problem I encountered is the 1v1 matches ppear to be very one sided to new comers like myself, with the matches seemingly very one sided to the AI. A noticeable feature I noticed is the AI are able to knock the ball out from your pincers and out of control whilst persuing behind you, thus sometimes making you lose control over a fairly won goal and missing a shot that is not quite lined up, whereas no matter how much I spam left or right click this never seems to have any effect on the AI as it does with me. This may just be down to my own skill level and not the games fault, however. 

Visually, I commend the designers for creating a pitch that refrains from being bland. The incoorperation of various obsticales makes the game play out in a less linear way, testing your ball contol skills and forcing you to sometimes chip the ball over walls and bounce the ball off them. Certain obsticales such as tires are interactive and can be knocked around the pitch to make it much harder to navigate and reach the ball, a very small but lovely touch I enjoyed. 

Overall I do enjoy this game on a casual level, and think I would get more fun with friends and more balanced matches. Personally, I don't think this game deserves its price tag it has currently, and think of this more of a ¬£1.75 game, this could just be me being a cheapskate. However, if new content is added I believe this will still be an enjoyable game. I do not regret buying this. However, if Rocket League is on sale I recommend you pick that game up in priority over Robot Soccer, as the experience is much better and there are more people playing Rocket League on the online multiplayer. 

I would give Robot Soccer a 6/10. :)
